556567381.reviewBody: We spent a day in Le\u00f3n after several days in Guanajuato and SMA.  So glad we did!  This museum is worth a 2-3 hour stop if you have time.  The permanent exhibits are professional and informative.  We speak Spanish fluently, and most audio was in Spanish; but English captions and placards were usually available as well.  The rotating temporary exhibits apparently vary, so check the site to see what is current.  I lost enjoyed seeing the rich history of the Baj\u00edo region in visual form.

The entire assembly is located in an area of 9 Acress and consists of: Central Library State Wigberto Jimenez Moreno, Museum of Art and History of Guanajuato Cultural Forum Guanajuato, Academic Unit for Culture and Arts of Leon of the University of Guanajuato , Teatro del Bicentenario and commercial area. The Forum is located in Poliforum polygon, an area where the exhibition center of the city is located.

224468410.author: a TripAdvisor user
224468410.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this museum a few times and I really love its design and the pieces of art that they have in exhibition. You can ask for a guided tour in English or in Spanish which is really helpful for those who don\'t speak a word of Spanish. There are some permanent exhibitions which are for free, and from time to time they do have some special exhibitions which are not expensive at all. It is located very close to downtown which makes it a perfect place to start getting to know the city. There\'s a huge library outside as well as a beautiful garden of statues and the Teatro del Bicentenario, which is another must-see. This whole area is a nice place to chill and to come enjoy either with friends, family or alone.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Aeropuerto No. 104 Cerrito de Jerez Norte

530700257.name: Best Shopping Center in the southern half of Leon
530700257.author: a TripAdvisor user
530700257.reviewBody: This is a relatively new, large, semi-enclosed, two-level, regional fashion mall with a large Liverpool department store, a very large H&M, fast fashion leader Zara, a C&A, and a variety of other fashion stores, along more than the usual number of restaurants and a cinema multiplex (Cinepolis). The project has quite a bit of parking, both surface and in a parking garage.  Visibility from the adjacent Blvd. Aeropuerto (also known as the Carretera Leon-Silao, and effectively the extension of Av. Adolfo Lopez Mateos south of the intersection with Av. Torres Landa). The project requires some good maneuvering if you are arriving by motor vehicle because of the complexity of the adjacent multi-level interchange.  The project is located just south of the Centro Max shopping center, a Home Depot, a Costco and a Mega hypermarket. This project does not have quite the number of stores that Plaza Mayor (in the north of Leon) has, but it has a better layout and design and offers a better pedestrian experience.  The project presents a bold and colorful facade to Blvd. Aeropuerto.  This project can not begin to compete with the large shopping centers in Mexico City, but for the Bajio, this is a good project and is definitely a place where one can spend a pleasant afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Aeropuerto No. 104 Cerrito de Jerez Norte

This one has an airy open air design, which is pleasant enough, but the real shopping in Leon is in the leather market near the bus station.

506646576.author: a TripAdvisor user
506646576.reviewBody:
Is just in the right point to start a wonderful walk around 5 to go all the way to the plaza principal, passing by the templo expiatorio, and enjoy a refreshing Mexican hand made gelato.

Or to start the night eating in the many great restaurants around, and continuing to a one of many fun bars in the madero street.

Or in the opposite direction, walk the nice old calzada, cruce the bridge of love over the malecón and continue all the way to the museum and rest in the lovely garden, and if you still have energy make it to the park explora passing by the wonderful teatro bicentenario. 

After that call an uber you will be very tired and not much good to eat, unless you walk back in the direction of the bridge of love and in the right site you go to the Rincon Gaucho tradicional, and enjoy a marvelous steak, a beer, and a empanada Argentina of cheese or meat, after all that you walk don't mind the calories

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

478121441.name: Icon for Leon
478121441.author: a TripAdvisor user
478121441.reviewBody: This is the icon for Leon with a LIon atop an arch.  This arch for the heros of Mexico is a stand out for this city.  The arch has long walkway up to it that leads to a bridge called the "Bridge of Love" that couple put locks on to show their love.  There are romanesque small statues that line the walkway as well as shade trees in either side of the walkway.  In the middle of the walkway is a large lamp with water spigots.  The lamp is very picturesque at night or day, particularly with the arch and lion in the background.  Behind the arch, you can also capture the beautiful gothic church in pictures,  On the walkway side of the arch are two lines of waterspouts shooting out of the ground.  On a hot day, they can provide some relief, but most children love to play in them.  This is definitely a must see if you want to see the sights of Le\u00f3n.

396433989.author: a TripAdvisor user
396433989.reviewBody: Arch crowned at its top has a sculpture of a bronze lion monument this monument is a neoclassical style with Doric columns, it is considered one of the greatest symbols identifying Leon, Guanajuato, Mexico located on the promenade of the Causeway heroes at the entrance to the downtown area, is located on a roundabout, which has a small fountain floor, benches and small gardens.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

369394789.name: Exploring Colonial Mexico
369394789.author: a TripAdvisor user
369394789.reviewBody: This is the center piece of what Leon is famous for shoes boots leather items. Where almost everyone you meet has a family member who has some credible relationship with this industry of Calzada. This monument to the industry is a must see when visiting the city. The area is close proximity to Centro de Convenciones.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

367022041.name: Impressive Arch/Monument. . .
367022041.author: a TripAdvisor user
367022041.reviewBody: This arch was built in 1896 and it is the symbol of this up coming city. The original lion on top was made out of concrete. It was later changed for one made out of bronze in 1958. The main avenue goes across and around this monument and the avenue has very nice trees in both sides and it\'s name is Calzada de Los Heroes (Heroes Avenue). The section of the city where the arch is located is a very nice section and there are restaurants, bars and stores. You should not miss a visit to see this monument.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

343421575.name: Part of a tour
343421575.author: a TripAdvisor user
343421575.reviewBody: This structure is not old but it has very old historic value and is worth a detour.  It stands over the old entrance to Leon.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

331527094.name: Landmark for a stroll in the parkway.
331527094.author: a TripAdvisor user
331527094.reviewBody: Another arch in a traffic circle but marks the end/beginning of a tree lined walk with benches  connecting to the Sagrato Corazon and then the historic center, mercados, plaza major, etal.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

310945420.name: Impressive & Historic
310945420.author: a TripAdvisor user
310945420.reviewBody: My wife and I went strolling in the "romantic district"  near the catetral expiatorio and saw the acro triunfal.  It is impressive and I think there is a park on the other side, but we didn\'t explore that far :(

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

295030536.name: Another "A Must See" Destination
295030536.author: a TripAdvisor user
295030536.reviewBody:
This Arc is located near the vicinity of the Basilica. 

On the other side of the Arc there is a beautiful park that is very clean and nicely landscaped. 

Definitely worth the visit.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

293049507.name: Different and Nice
293049507.author: a TripAdvisor user
293049507.reviewBody: Lovely arch and both sides have lovely roads with nice trees on each side. Sort of like Mexicos version of Frances Arc de Triumphe. Makes for a nice entrance and exit into the town of Leon.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

252013722.name: Bell\u00edsimo
252013722.author: a TripAdvisor user
252013722.reviewBody: Must see! This defines Leon in its own! Also if you go at night it\'s very peaceful and also there is a couple of taco stand that\'s are really good for a quick taco snack..

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

234698148.name: One side only
234698148.author: a TripAdvisor user
234698148.reviewBody: As one approaches, this is one impressive arch (although I am a little puzzled about a "triumphant" arch dedicated to fallen heroes since they didn\'t "triumph" much, being dead) but the other side is very bare bones. Odd, I thought.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

231576346.name: Beautiful arcos
231576346.author: a TripAdvisor user
231576346.reviewBody: This is a magnificent archway leading to the historic area of Leon.  It is beautifully done and there is a lot of construction and renovations being done to beautify the city. \nYou can\'t beat the weather here either. Walking around the city is a wonderful way to spend the day.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

218018374.name: Nice light show
218018374.author: a TripAdvisor user
218018374.reviewBody: We enjoy the walking and light show. Its nice and many familes  like the safety walk time. also is close to any place of the city.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

214761578.name: What a Way to Make an Entrance
214761578.author: a TripAdvisor user
214761578.reviewBody: This arch is the gateway to the historical and cultural district of Leon, and what and entrance it makes: truly an iconic site.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

185116419.name: Beautiful Leones Icon
185116419.author: a TripAdvisor user
185116419.reviewBody: It\'s just beautiful and the touristic corridor is inviting and you can walk without any issues, it is beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Arco Triunfal de la Calzada de los Heroes

address.streetAddress: Calzada de los Heroes, Zona Centro

619579051.name: Beautiful
619579051.author: a TripAdvisor user
619579051.reviewBody: This church is beautiful inside when the lights are on.  A great surprise.  They were working on the front when we were there.  But definitely worth a look.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

559106174.name: awesome
559106174.author: a TripAdvisor user
559106174.reviewBody: this cathedral is extremely beautiful. It is immense and very lovely. The altars are spectacular. The art is incredible. I loved being inside this church.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

511441821.name: Pretty church
511441821.author: a TripAdvisor user
511441821.reviewBody: This church is located near the main plazas, not as indicated on the map. It makes a nice tranquil spot for escaping the noise and bustle outside.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

467106634.name: Main Church
467106634.author: a TripAdvisor user
467106634.reviewBody: This church is the cathedral of Leon its construction of a sense of protection and peace, hay that visitation to feel it through the atrium and explanation in front of the sight of a beautiful view, to enjoy it with family in the center of the city .

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

435423423.name: Very beautiful inside
435423423.author: a TripAdvisor user
435423423.reviewBody: Much more interesting inside than outside, and much more decorated than the Templo Expiatorio, I found this church to be more interesting than the Expiatory. Here as well are many Mexicans coming to pray.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

412292751.name: Another large church
412292751.author: a TripAdvisor user
412292751.reviewBody: There are many beautiful churches in Mexico, this one is just average, nice but not stunning. Walk around the old town instead.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

398722468.name: Beautiful
398722468.author: a TripAdvisor user
398722468.reviewBody: This is worth a visit while in Leon. It\'s well preserved and a crowning jewel in Leon. It is still in use, so we stayed in the entrance area to respect the worshippers. A great place to reflect on how lucky we were to be in Leon.\n Lively people watching nearby also.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

377438088.name: Amazing place
377438088.author: a TripAdvisor user
377438088.reviewBody: Lots of history here. Beautiful well maintained Church. The painting of Mary in the Altar was painted in the 18th century in Palermo, Italy and found its way to this magnificent Church. \n

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

373657768.name: beautiful church
373657768.author: a TripAdvisor user
373657768.reviewBody: visited this amazing cathedral. beautiful ceilings. this would be an awesome place for a wedding. its located downtown so its a good place to visit on your way to shopping

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

369395612.name: Exploring Leon Centro
369395612.author: a TripAdvisor user
369395612.reviewBody: The entire area around this cathedral has been redone to cater to armies of tourists to the area. Lots of small boutiques, small cafes and  many unique shops to mill about. The area is adjacent to La Zona Peatonal with its shops and the municipal plaza is an adventure not to be missed. There are daily flights from DFW to Leon and takes about 2 hours so take a hop there to enjoy La Zona Bajia in central Mexico.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Basilica De Nuestra Madre Santisima De La Luz

address.streetAddress: Alvaro Obregon Corner of Hidalgo, Centro

668373542.name: Amazing experience
668373542.author: a TripAdvisor user
668373542.reviewBody: This is by far the best zoo I have been to in a long time. (besides San Diego Zoo) It has a great safari experience, different exhibits inside and all kinds of animals.  My son enjoyed the kids park area and the atmosphere was educational and fun.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

526281032.name: Great parque for a verry low price
526281032.author: a TripAdvisor user
526281032.reviewBody: It is a real nice tropical parque with all kind of annimals. From goats till tigers from spiders till elephants... Wow... Safari takes ca. 30 minutes and for the rest you can walk in the beautifull tropical parque.. This time we were there 4 hrs and ee go back next week to see the rest. On monday and tuesday entree is 50% but also on the other days it is not that expensive... For us it is \u2019a must seen when you visit Leon Gto.\' Verry impressive in the middle of the city.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

506769331.name: Fun adventure
506769331.author: a TripAdvisor user
506769331.reviewBody:
I didn't expect I would enjoy this much. I started my visit with the safari tour and is just great, the guides are fun and the whole tour is just great and how close you get to the animals, was Wednesday so there wasn't much people and also was around 11:00 si it wasn't hot, I did enjoy a lot and my little one as well.

Then the rest of the zoo is well taking care off, we enjoy the long walk and also the part with the farm animals, is always a joy to pet the baby goats.

My favorite part is the giraffes and the elephants.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

502654325.name: Finally some trees in Le\u00f3n!!!
502654325.author: a TripAdvisor user
502654325.reviewBody:
We were surprised by this beautiful location. The prices are moderate, they give you several options and price packages that includes that thing or the other. 
You get to see a lot of animals, surrounded by trees and shadow!!! 
Did not eat there, but i actually did not see any restaurante or suitable option for us. Many people brought their food and made a pic nic there. 
Nice experience. Coming back for sure.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

496912585.name: A day at the Zoo!
496912585.author: a TripAdvisor user
496912585.reviewBody: Went to the zoo with my girlfriend and we had a really good time. A little bit hot but that\'s normal here in Mexico. But as in the zoo and the service it\'s excellent. Don\'t have to complaint about anything. A really nice place for  a family picnic day!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

482915487.name: Visiting animals at zoo
482915487.author: a TripAdvisor user
482915487.reviewBody: As you may be wondering, this place is quite big, you will walk a lot and you will need water every 15 minutes, but the visit is worthy if you are an animal lover. \nThe only bad thing is that the poor creatures looks a little bit abandoned, but your visit will contribute to make their lives better.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

474388085.name: Natural environment, open, unnexpensive, a must vist when visting this City
474388085.author: a TripAdvisor user
474388085.reviewBody: This city it\'s not even the capital of the State but sure this atraction would make you think it is.\nYou can even experience a Safari Tour within the park.\nAll animals are free of cages and attractions besides animals make a nice experience for the entire family.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

448091736.name: Nice place to spend a day in Leon
448091736.author: a TripAdvisor user
448091736.reviewBody: The zoo has many unusual animals  not seen in the US. Nice shady walkways, lots of flowers and birds. A great Safari tram ride among free roaming giraffes, Mexican longhorns, deer, ostriches, etc. (costs a few extra pesos) also an area of rides if you are there with children. A changing seasonal exhibit area...right now it is Dinosaurs. A great value, low cost, pleasant way to spend a day outside \u00c1vila in Leon.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

437207556.name: A very enjoyable few hours
437207556.author: a TripAdvisor user
437207556.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours at the zoo and it was thoroughly enjoyable. Some of the enclosures for the big cats in particular are a little small it overall the conditions in which the animals are kept are very good and they are in excellent condition. There are plenty of opportunities to get close too - the white rhino was undoubtedly our favourite! Lovely setting and plenty of places to drop for snacks and soft drinks.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

432664768.name: Nice zoo!
432664768.author: a TripAdvisor user
432664768.reviewBody: I was impressed with the size of this zoo for a city like Le\u00f3n. Quite large, with a safari. Be careful on a rainy day though, it gets super muddy to the point that you can\'t walk to the safari area. Needs attention.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

417528311.name: Animals!!
417528311.author: a TripAdvisor user
417528311.reviewBody: I love the zoo and if you love it too then Dont forget to pass by it\'s really big and you can se lots and lots of kind of species \nAnd theirs also a safari\ud83d\ude1d\ud83d\ude0d

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

379207131.name: Very nice walk through the woods
379207131.author: a TripAdvisor user
379207131.reviewBody: The enclosures are not great, but the stroll is very enjoyable, especially if you have small kids. There is a nice petting zoo, and a small safari, too.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

359930778.name: Great place to visit
359930778.author: a TripAdvisor user
359930778.reviewBody: Although the habitats are a bit smaller than I would like, the place is beautiful. They have a lot of space, trees and wander the place is a pretty nice experience. Wear comfortable shoes. And consider taking some food to make a picnic. The even have a special picnic section you can use. I had a lovely day visiting this place.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

350281709.name: very safe and interesting for families with children. Muy seguro e interesante para los ni\u00f1os
350281709.author: a TripAdvisor user
350281709.reviewBody:
Este zoológico es la forma mas económica y segura que me he encontrado para llevar a mi niña (3 años) a aprender y convivir con la naturaleza. 
Es un Zoologico interactivo instructivo, ya que cada jaula te incluye información interesante con la que me sentí un gran maestro. La única pregunta que no pude responder a mi niña es; Porque están encerrados los animalitos, hicieron algo malo? Pero si vas a un zoologico y tu niño te sorprende, ten preparada la respuesta. 
Pase un excelente rato, el zafari es muy corto, pero SI debes contratarlo porque es muy barato y vale la pena la experiencia, es una probadita de safari. 

RECOMENDADO PARA FAMILIAS!

This zoo is the most economical and safe way I 've found to take my girl ( 3 years) to learn and live with nature .
It is an instructive petting zoo , as each cage will include interesting information that I felt a great teacher. The only question I could not answer my girl is ; Why are they locked the animals , they did something wrong? But if you go to a zoo and your child surprises , be ready with the answer . 

Spend an excellent time , the zafari is very short , but if you hire him because it's very cheap and worth the experience, it's a taste of safari.

RECOMMENDED FOR FAMILIES

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

317807519.name: Great Zoo
317807519.author: a TripAdvisor user
317807519.reviewBody: A should not miss.  Take the Safari  .which gets you up close and personal with the animals and the cost is very low.  The zoo is clean, pretty, nicely landscaped and the animals are well cared for.  All and all a nice way to spend the day\n  If you bri\u00f1g  a picnic there are tables and even bbq\'s.\n

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

262927188.name: Awesome Zoo
262927188.author: a TripAdvisor user
262927188.reviewBody: Nice place for nature lovers, ideal for family or couples highly recommended soon be back to this beautiful place

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

255639166.name: Mexican zoos are awesome!
255639166.author: a TripAdvisor user
255639166.reviewBody: My wife and I visited this zoo on the last full day of our Guanajuato vacation.  I love to visit zoos in Mexico and this one was no exception.  There were many different types of animals in various habitats, inexpensive y muy rico food for sale at the food stands and I was amazed at how clean they kept the facility.  Also, the grass was amazing...the ex-landscaper in me was envious of their lawns! \n\nThe safari portion was great too.  The staff looked to have made a very open and well kept space for the animals to run...they seemed to enjoy watching us riding by on the truck bed just as much as we did them.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

252178207.name: Go when they first open
252178207.author: a TripAdvisor user
252178207.reviewBody: This zoo is better than any zoo I have ever been to in the U.S., by far. My wife says so too. We take everybody who comes to visit to the zoo eventually. Go as soon as they open because the animals are still pacing all over the place and fighting and playing and mating. Super cool place. You can get really close to the animals. Very humane and wonderful place. If I were an animal in a zoo, I would want to be in this one.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

213272774.name: Kids loved it.
213272774.author: a TripAdvisor user
213272774.reviewBody: An impressive array of animals!. Plenty to see and do. Very friendly people. A great passtime for the children.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

185826845.name: Lovely
185826845.author: a TripAdvisor user
185826845.reviewBody: I took my children on a Saturday morning and my first surprise was to get 50% off on saturday!!! It is a very quiet and well organised park, with so many tall trees, like being in the woods. The animals seem to enjoy their captivity and their environment looks just fine to them. The have so many animals in there! It is a great place to take your children or even your couple for a great ride. No one gets bored!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

170196789.name: The night safari is a special treat
170196789.author: a TripAdvisor user
170196789.reviewBody: I visited both the Zoo and the night safari. For visitors from Europe or the US, this zoo will seem small and less commercial than a typical zoo. However, the animals are still fun to observe and there are many places to have a picnic or snack. The collection is surprisingly varied. It\'s a good way to spend several hours in Leon and a nice way to get some exercise in the city. \nThe night safari was a lot of fun: there was a musical/dancing presentation in the lobby area, then we moved on to small open buses, and took a guided tour (in Spanish) of the area with the extremely funny and engaging guide. Using a spotlight we were able to see many of the different species present in that part of the zoo, and we were able to hand feed some of the cattle which approached the bus. We were on the bus about 45 mins, and it was entertaining the whole time.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

157535658.name: Much better on a cloudy day
157535658.author: a TripAdvisor user
157535658.reviewBody: One of the few places in Leon for the kids, the zoo is well maintained. The walks are very long, and in some areas you will not find a single shadow. Buy a hat for the kids with an foam animal at the entrance of the zoo, they are very practical, inexpensive, and kids love them.  \nIf you go early when the day is still fresh or on a cloudy day, the animals will be much more active, otherwise you will see them lazy, slept at the corner or not seen at all. \nIn the past, the zoo allowed feeding the giraffes, and other animals with carrots and apples and it was a great experience for the kids as they interacted directly with the animals, however they no longer accept this after some animals got sick (many people gave them chips and stuff). Today you can only buy some crumbles from the specific machines to feed the ducks and the ostriches, so make sure to take "1 peso" coins with you.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

155789715.name: Good option to take kids out the weekend
155789715.author: a TripAdvisor user
155789715.reviewBody: It\'s a small zoo, but keeps the public entertained with the different species. surprisingly very clean! Ad the small farm where you get to feed the baby goats is very fun. don\'t miss the Orangutan!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

155112721.name: Have night safari!
155112721.author: a TripAdvisor user
155112721.reviewBody: Zoologico Leon has night safari which runs every saturday.\n\nIt was worth to visit and we had fun there.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Ibarrilla s/n

670035288.name: Great for shopping for leather
670035288.author: a TripAdvisor user
670035288.reviewBody: Very interesting and amazing place. A lot of one of a kind leather goods, shoes and purses.  We found better prices for leather goods (jackets, wallets and shoes) to be found further away from Manelly Plaza. We walked each street and found better deals a few blocks away.  Found it odd that no one really wanted to bargain in the Plaza but a few blocks away was a different story. Happy shopping

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

657375411.name: Cheap but quality issues
657375411.author: a TripAdvisor user
657375411.reviewBody: This was our second trip to leon specifically to shop at Zona piel. Last time we each bought leather jackets. This time she bought a purse and I got a cheap bag for electronics. There is not much quality here but lots of cheap leather goods. Would like to know where the fine leather goods are???

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

631483008.name: Hard to find but worth the effort
631483008.author: a TripAdvisor user
631483008.reviewBody: We had two hours from getting off the bus from Sam Miguel to getting back on. We had a very specific list. All around the bus station is junk. With the help of shopkeepers, but with no directional signage, we found the plaza we were looking for, about four blocks from the bes station. Fixed prices.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

622137698.name: Must-Shop Leon
622137698.author: a TripAdvisor user
622137698.reviewBody: I hate shopping. That\'s not my travel style. BUT, living in Leon for 4 months meant that I was obligated to go to the famous leather market. Knowing that these shoes are made right here is pretty cool and there are tons of cheap and more expensive options for those who are looking to buy shoes, bags, wallets, etc.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

621457185.name: Lots of leather (real and fake) and *steak*!
621457185.author: a TripAdvisor user
621457185.reviewBody: Zona Piel covers about 6-8 blocks (each one seems to focus on a particular type of apparel (one block is mostly hand-bags, another is jackets, another is boots, etc). It\'s not *strictly* that way, but it feels like you see more of one type of leather good on one block, etc.\nThe blocks surround a shopping mall (make sure to go inside for some really upscale leather good from the stores like Cuadra. Also note that there are a few steak houses very close to the mall. Maybe not coincidence.\nThe leather goods are of varying quality, so shop around before you decide what you\'re going to buy.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

602415035.name: " So much Shopping amazing prices "
602415035.author: a TripAdvisor user
602415035.reviewBody: Shop for Quality Discount Handbags and . Look for the newest additions to  collection to find the latest trends at the best prices. Genuine Leather Bags and shoes !! Love this Place .

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

561765109.name: Grat prices, high quality leather goods
561765109.author: a TripAdvisor user
561765109.reviewBody: the zone can look a bit shady as its close to the bus terminal and there are many street vendors and lost of people walking but, it was very safe. many stores with really good prices on leather goods.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

560040462.name: A maze of shoes and leather goods
560040462.author: a TripAdvisor user
560040462.reviewBody: Right across from the main bus station you can see the leather district, about three blocks across by three deep.  A number of larger buildings that are filled with smaller stalls and shops, dedicated to ever type of leather good. The stuff is cheap, very cheap in many cases, and the quality is fair to good. It all really comes down to one\u2019s pocket book. We always find something of interest.  It gets very busy on Saturdays and Sunday morning particularly. There is parking at the Plaza del Zapato on the corner.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

547679048.name: So much shopping...
547679048.author: a TripAdvisor user
547679048.reviewBody: Bought shoes, jackets, briefcase and more.  Lots of options.  Prices are great.  It can be overwhelming as many booths carry the same items.  Go with plenty of time to browse before you decide what to buy.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

546682100.name: Don\'t be overwhelmed
546682100.author: a TripAdvisor user
546682100.reviewBody: Zona Piel is packed with leather goods, shoes and handbags.  Be sure to look around before buying and bargain for a good deal.  We walked around and grabbed an adorable tote for 110 pesos before jumping on our bus to San Miguel de Allende.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

467829262.name: Don\'t be confused about the location.
467829262.author: a TripAdvisor user
467829262.reviewBody:
We came in on the bus from Guanajuato and passed many stores and malls with "Shoes!" Written all over them.  We didn't go there.  Ride the bus to its terminus, walk out the front doors, look across the street at shopping mayhem, dive in.
I'm not a shopper, but I enjoyed the leather smell and articles. I really wish I wanted some fancy cowboy boots---they were tempting. I priced some kid boots--350 pesos before any bartering.  The same guy had fantastic leather and reptile men's boots.
If you walk further out maybe 3-4 blocks, you will come to suppliers of the materials and little shops making leather stuff.  
Not much food avail in the Zona cause the space is so valuable, so watch for that restaurant you want before you need it.  Also, found some English at the mkt.  More than in Guanajuato.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

462560581.name: Shoes and handbags galore
462560581.author: a TripAdvisor user
462560581.reviewBody: Plenty of shoes and handbags at reasonable prices, mostly made in the area.  Not too much in the way of good quality.   I bought a designer handbag in a store called Maxwell at the Nuevo estancia hotel down the street.  Great leather bags with a touch of Mexican design, it cost $165 US dollars.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

455522477.name: I hate shopping . . .
455522477.author: a TripAdvisor user
455522477.reviewBody: The area is a sensory overload of shops, street vendors and manufacturers.   I had no intention of buying much but after some factory tours that we had arranged, I started looking around and found that if you have any desire for leather goods, you can get them here . . . for cheap.  If you are careful and patient, you can get some great quality for a 1/4 of what you would pay at home.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

452479192.name: Get a jacket!
452479192.author: a TripAdvisor user
452479192.reviewBody: At first you\'ll be overwhelmed with thousands of shoes, from tennies (all are rip offs, btw) to dress shoes to cowboy boots. However the best finds here are the leather jackets which run from about 700 to 1500 pesos depending on quality and design. Generally speaking, the further inside the market you get, the better the deals. Thrre are even stores that will make jackets to your size and specifications.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

448096573.name: Shop the day away...bargains galore!
448096573.author: a TripAdvisor user
448096573.reviewBody: This is an area with a maze of many street blocks, offering leather shoes, boots of all styles, sandals, tennis shoes, leather coats, purses, hats, luggage and more! Quality ranges from low to high. Bought hand stiched, nice leather boots for  30 USD. Leather coat, soft and nice, 40 USd. Belt 5 USD. This could be a 2 day event...the area is so big...so many stalls, shops. Looks like a sketchy part of town, right by bus station. But as a woman by myself, never had any problems. People nice, helpful. Parking at bus station  or side streets, look for "E" on signs in front of buildings. About 75 cents an hour. Uber is cheap too. If you like shopping and have patience to explore, this is an amazing experience! Wear comfortable shoes! Try the yummy street vendor chia-lemonade (agua lim\u00f3n) for about 30 cents! Delicious! I only speak a little Spanish and could get by...just have them write down the asking price and write down 20% less in return..that worked well for me!

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

437208803.name: Okay but nothing special
437208803.author: a TripAdvisor user
437208803.reviewBody: As others have said this is a very busy area with lots and lots of shops selling mostly the same kind of thing or mass produced and relatively low quality leather goods rather than anything handcrafted and/or high quality. I bough s leather jacket which was pretty cheap (less than \u00a330) but it\'s functional rather than anything special. Worth a visit but don\'t expect to find anything special

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

425466193.name: ok, but not great
425466193.author: a TripAdvisor user
425466193.reviewBody: a lot of low quality goods. Very difficult to find anything of high quality. Cheap in both price and quality.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

422533883.name: Impresive quantity and diversity of leather articles
422533883.author: a TripAdvisor user
422533883.reviewBody: It is not a fancy place at all! but the offer for different leather articles and boots is impresive, at a particular boots store we found or at least salesman informed us they have Hipo, Elephant, Croc, Piton, Stingray among others.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

400394851.name: Overwhelming amount of stores and products.
400394851.author: a TripAdvisor user
400394851.reviewBody: Many shopping options for leather goods.  You must be careful to make sure it is real leather and not fake.  The prices were super good.  My wife bought a beautiful leather purse for $35 which would have sold in the U.S. for around $150.  Plan on spending at least 5 hours here if you want to do some serious shopping.  Start in front of the bus station and work your way back.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

398724746.name: Good, Bad and Ugly
398724746.author: a TripAdvisor user
398724746.reviewBody: I wanted some Lobo Solo shoes but they don\'t have size 10 for gringa ladies. You\'ll have more luck up to 7. Lots of synthetic materials but they were honest about it or it was marked as such.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

392540280.name: WOW
392540280.author: a TripAdvisor user
392540280.reviewBody: There are hundreds of leather shops as well as fabric stores and a huge leather mall. I buy my indoor/outdoor fabric in Zona piel for a very low price. Be prepared to spend a day or two browsing and buying.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

359197867.name: Not your everyday mercado
359197867.author: a TripAdvisor user
359197867.reviewBody: Fascinating to see all the various bits and pieces that are involved in the leather industry. Shop keepers are friendly and willing to chat if they aren\'t busy. I recommend going later in the day rather than morning which is reserved for craft customers.\n

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

357834342.name: Trying to be diplomatic ---- but hmmmm
357834342.author: a TripAdvisor user
357834342.reviewBody: - Zona Piel - the name is  misleading; Zona sint\u00e9tica is more like it. In fact there is very little real leather for sale. \nCheap fake leather, fake LV, fake Michael Kors, etc. goods everywhere. Mass manufactured in China and imported (a crying shame). There are some Western stores (few and far in between) that sell crocodile, ostrich and leather boots and accessories but in general the Zona Piel is not a good place to find anything of value. This is my second time here, I wanted to give it another chance. All in all I spent approx 3-4 hours / each day (a total of 8) checking out the goods, the stores, the people, etc. I hardly found a pair of shoes made out of leather. Sad to say but Chinatown in New York has better goods (if that is your thing). \nLeon however has big leather fairs, leather factories, showrooms (you have to make an appointment) but the Zona Piel (for retail goods) is pitiful. I am an accessories designer and have bought leather all over the world. This was disappointing

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

335782501.name: Great leather goods
335782501.author: a TripAdvisor user
335782501.reviewBody: This is a large leather goods shopping center. All manner of jackets, bags, gloves, pants...etc. Tons of small shops. All very friendly and SUPER AFFORDABLE. A must visit.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

328468774.name: Amazing product and Better Deals
328468774.author: a TripAdvisor user
328468774.reviewBody: Going to try and keep this short: If you are in or near Leon, go to the Leather area. Very good deals on anything leather: Shoes, boots, belts, purses, etc, etc....\nI picked up a great pair of boots for $26. Would have paid upwards of $300 in USA.\nWe visited the Leather Stores/Stalls/Shops right across the street from the bus station. Have fun and happy shopping.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

320777545.name: Great place to browse or buy
320777545.author: a TripAdvisor user
320777545.reviewBody: Best thing: the vendors are friendly and don\'t hassle you to buy. The belts have prices marked, which seemed the same in many of the stores. The adjacent "Indoor" plazas also offer some very nice products. Something for everyone at the right price point!

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

319160657.name: Leon\'s best attraction?
319160657.author: a TripAdvisor user
319160657.reviewBody: Shopping in the leather district is a must-do for visitors to both Leon & nearby Guanajuato. Easy to get to, the bus station is in the heart of the district. Busy, bustling & colorful.  You do need to be discerning these days, as more and more stuff is imported from China.  One store I like supplies product to a shop in San Miguel where it\'s resold for triple the price.  It\'s tempting to wanna start at the Plaza De Zapatos at the entrance to the district, but that\'s no different than shopping at any mall in the US. Skip it.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

318941376.name: Leather Products Anyone?
318941376.author: a TripAdvisor user
318941376.reviewBody:
Thanks to TripAdvisor staff for finally approving a listing for the Zona Piel after years of rejections!

With 4500+ "Mom & Pop" type and 300+ Corporate stores that specialize in all types of leather products (Jackets, coats, vests, purses, briefcases, luggage, wallets, hats, belts, saddles, tack, cowboy boots, fashion boots, sandals, shoes of all types, athletic footwear and just about anything else one can dream up) - this is a phenomenon well worth the time and effort to experience! And why is it located in Leon?  Leon's primary claim to fame is that, it is recognized around the world as Mexico's Leather Capital.

One should approach this experience with some caution as there is a huge range in quality and some products may not be what they appear to be on the surface.  For example, you will probably see well known popular brand names on numerous types of products but they may have no connection to the actual brand?  An astute shopper can have a great deal of fun in this district and should be able to come away with some prudent purchases.

For those who wish to make this more than a one day experience, there is a Holiday Inn directly across Blvd Adolfo Lopez Mateos from the Zona Piel and numerous decent restaurants in walking distance.

address.streetAddress: Hilario Medina 400

650364835.name: Aquarium inside a Mall !
650364835.author: a TripAdvisor user
650364835.reviewBody:
First let´s put expectations straight, this place is a tourist attraction inside a mall. called “Altacia” in other words this is NO waterpark.  
Being that said and being honest this is a great place to relax, and to have a great time with family and friends.  
The Aquarium is well equipped has lots of exotic fishes like sharks, medusas, ills even reptiles at the end of the trip. 
If you have any questions there will always be somebody to aid you. 
Fish tanks are huge beautiful and clean, also the ambience is a plus with relaxing sounds all the way.  
I have to say there is no cons  for this attraction, except it is a bit short,  the ride will last about 1 hr. 30 min approximately. 
I do recommend this attraction for tourists and local people if you have 1 or 2 free hrs. and 150 Mexican pesos to spare.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Aeropuerto 104 Cerrito de Jerez Norte

622138186.name: Skip This Spot
622138186.author: a TripAdvisor user
622138186.reviewBody: If you are visiting Leon, Mexico, this is not a place you need to visit. First of all, the city is landlocked and nowhere near the ocean, so it is saddening that these animals were removed from the ocean to be housed here. The tanks were dirty, with some even containing dead fish and other sea creatures while living ones swam around them. Just a sad experience. I did not personally want to visit, but went with a group. It\'s a short walk-through aquarium.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Aeropuerto 104 Cerrito de Jerez Norte

581830878.name: Good relax for weekend
581830878.author: a TripAdvisor user
581830878.reviewBody: This nice and educative acuario is a great option for weekend with kids. Strong recommendation is to go there early. You can breath. Later afternoon is full. And a good think is that its in a shopping mall, so you can park, shop and eat good.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Aeropuerto 104 Cerrito de Jerez Norte

537531479.name: Excellent science museum
537531479.author: a TripAdvisor user
537531479.reviewBody: One of the most complete and modern science museums in Mexico. Under the concept of  "do not touch is forbidden" children really get fun while learning.

address.streetAddress: Calle San Francisco 202 La Martinica

511441182.name: Interesting ourdoor exhibits
511441182.author: a TripAdvisor user
511441182.reviewBody: This museum is located in a nice park south of Leon\'s Bicentenial Theater. Some historical trains and airplanes are on exhibit outside the museum. Fascinating!

address.streetAddress: Calle San Francisco 202 La Martinica

474382648.name: Public Park, you won\'t believe it\'s free here in M\u00e9xico. Multi activities for the kids and family
474382648.author: a TripAdvisor user
474382648.reviewBody:
Right by the City Fair ParkGrounds, the city Soccer Stadium, City Polyforum Convention center it's this park. 
It does have plenty of activities for kids: rental bikes, train, Goose Lake, technological museum, picnic areas, etc.
and IT'S FREE !!!!
Nice walk thru trees and paths.

address.streetAddress: Calle San Francisco 202 La Martinica

396429829.name: Great for Children of 3 years an up.
396429829.author: a TripAdvisor user
396429829.reviewBody: The Explora Museum is an interactive science museum in Leon, Mexico loosely modeled after San Francisco\'s Exploratorium. It houses many children events and summer courses inside the Explora Park. The museum contains over 300 interactive attractions, as well as a 3D auditorium, planetarium, television studio, and vivarium. The museum opened in 1994.

address.streetAddress: Calle San Francisco 202 La Martinica

581832033.name: Vow
581832033.author: a TripAdvisor user
581832033.reviewBody: So many shoes in one place is very unique in the whole world. In addition to that i didn\u2019t really expect such high quality and variety of the products.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Aeropuerto 843 Col. Predio de Santa Anita

560041986.name: The big shoe mall in Leon
560041986.author: a TripAdvisor user
560041986.reviewBody: This is the big popular shoe outlet in Leon today.  The place really fills up on weekends.  The stores are all independent, and there are large open-air walkways to accommodate the crowds.  Weekdays there are a lot less people. Parking is free.  They have a food court, and clean bathrooms throughout the mall. \n\nWe have visited a handful of times, and there are good bargains on the top tier brands, as well as the cheaper brands, something really for everyone.  Adjacent to that outlet is a second outlet with the Nike store, and a handful of other brand clothing stores like Calvin Klein, Guess etc. It is worth a look.

address.streetAddress: Blvd Aeropuerto 843 Col. Predio de Santa Anita

527166614.name: Nice Mall
527166614.author: a TripAdvisor user
527166614.reviewBody: Large mall that would satisfy most shoppers. Lots of dining and actually pretty good areas to relax as well if you need to rest your feet.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

526106890.name: Clean and green
526106890.author: a TripAdvisor user
526106890.reviewBody: What a great little patch of green at the heart of the city.  Lots of french inspired benches to sit on and people watch

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

466986240.name: Good place to hang out!
466986240.author: a TripAdvisor user
466986240.reviewBody: Open air mall with parking lot, ideal for shopping because of the variety of stores you can find. Also you can find a good restaurant to eat. Ideal for families. It is very accesible from the main streets of the city.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

421469215.name: Love this place for shopping or dining
421469215.author: a TripAdvisor user
421469215.reviewBody: This is the first shopping center in Leon, Gto and it was recently renovated to include more open air spaces.  I love the old and the new.  It is greatly located in a neighborhood with lots of restaurants and trendy places to visit.  The plaza has lots of great stores such as Zara, Liverpool, and many others.  Great restaurant such as Chilis, Olive Garden, and others.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

386632606.name: Quite alright
386632606.author: a TripAdvisor user
386632606.reviewBody: Very good access to the parking lot from all four streets surrounding the mall. The underground parking is very small, and the ground level parking lots are terrible, lots of cars parked where they shouldn\'t, some because the spots are not clearly marked, most because drivers just don\'t care about forbidden areas, i.e. wheelchair ramps, fire hose connections, etc. Apparently the plaza has no authority over ensuring the parking lots are safe. Good store variety and brand selection.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

379437690.name: The largest mall in the city
379437690.author: a TripAdvisor user
379437690.reviewBody: This mall is split into two sections, old and new, if you need to shop for something you will likely find it here, they even have some local leather goods sellers (more of the designer type but still local).

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Juan Alonso de Torres No. 2002 Int. 1032 Col. Valle del Campestre

598388305.name: Very interesting place
598388305.author: a TripAdvisor user
598388305.reviewBody: Nice insight in the local culture and science. Linked to the university of Gujanto Leon. Although an nice place to relax

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908 Colonia La Martinica

510165797.name: Urban osasis
510165797.author: a TripAdvisor user
510165797.reviewBody: Leon\'s Cultural Forum is truly a special spot in the middle of a busy city full of traffic. A short walk from the bus station and leather market, this complex includes the Bicentenial Theater, the Guanajuato Museum, and part of the State University. The large plaza outside is perfect for a stroll or for a rest on one of the plentiful benches.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908 Colonia La Martinica

504009145.name: Efren Hernandez Exhibition
504009145.author: a TripAdvisor user
504009145.reviewBody: This month I went to see the current exhibition of writer Efren Hernandez, the most famous short story writer, known for mainly a story called "Tachas" which I deeply recommend. \n\nThe exhibition showed some of his early drafts, hand written notes which made it a visit worth taking. Just to be inside this building is worth your visit.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908 Colonia La Martinica

308579361.name: A beautiful modern theater
308579361.author: a TripAdvisor user
308579361.reviewBody: I am a musician and have played here a number of times for both orchestral concerts and opera productions. It\'s a beautiful modern theater with surprisingly good acoustics - a real gem. It\'s amazing that there is no resident orchestra that plays here weekly!

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

284222682.name: Must to go
284222682.author: a TripAdvisor user
284222682.reviewBody: This a fantastic scenario for appreciating opera, concerts and ballet. Hopefully you are in town on season, actually prices are really reasonable and the quality is superior.

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

267809394.name: Amazing venue, world-class performances
267809394.author: a TripAdvisor user
267809394.reviewBody: Without doubt one of the best cultural Theaters in America. Amazing selection of opera, ballet, classical Music and theatre. Top notch acoustics in a beautiful building located in a thriving cultural complex.

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

234939085.name: First class concert hall
234939085.author: a TripAdvisor user
234939085.reviewBody: This is beautiful new(ish) concert hall located on the grounds of a large cultural center.  The exterior is striking and the interior is clean, attractive and comfortable.   The acoustics and sightlines are very good.

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

188293405.name: A world class theater in Leon
188293405.author: a TripAdvisor user
188293405.reviewBody: I performed in this theater while on a tour with an orchestra. We played a number of venues in Mexico, all of which were excellent, but this ultra new (2010) theater is really incredible. It was beautiful looking out from the stage and the acoustics are very fine.\n\nFrom the outside the architecture is dazzling and the setting is perfect. A real treasure.

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

185825974.name: Fabulous
185825974.author: a TripAdvisor user
185825974.reviewBody: One of the greatest theatres I\'ve ever visited. Expressly built for opera performances, is one of a kind in the world. It\'s worth the visit, but mostly while attending a play.

address.streetAddress: Prol. Calzada de los Heroes 908 Vasco de Quiroga , Col. La Martinica Leon

555607779.name: Amazing Convention Center in a small, historic town
555607779.author: a TripAdvisor user
555607779.reviewBody: This convention center is new and modern.  It has beautiful meeting rooms of all sizes.  It is a great place for meeting and events.  It has food areas and there is a Starbucks with an outside entrance that is charming.  One hotel connects directly and it has a fabulous restaurant with a buffet of Brasil that is very reasonable in price.  The convention personnel are very helpful and most speak at least a little English and other languages.  Several other hotel is within easy walking distance and there are also some nice restaurants nearby.  There is excellent bus service and taxis are very reasonable and abundant.  It is also within easy walking distance of a cinema that has great prices.

address.streetAddress: Blvrd. Adolfo Lopez Mateos, s/n

467828427.name: A large campus which houses exhibitions and fairground
467828427.author: a TripAdvisor user
467828427.reviewBody: This is an huge fairground space which houses concerts, fairs, exhibitions and sport activities. It is packed with hundred thousands visitors during the Feria, a month long event in January.

address.streetAddress: Blvrd. Adolfo Lopez Mateos, s/n

665981239.name: Barca - Messi
665981239.author: a TripAdvisor user
665981239.reviewBody: What a great experience to watch a match in this fantastic stadium and a match between no 1 & 2. Great access, easy exit.\nWorked well.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

573904624.name: April Fools Joke? SADLY NOT
573904624.author: a TripAdvisor user
573904624.reviewBody: Took 20 footballing teenagers on 1st April, and believe me the appalling treatment of a boy in a wheelchair with a broken leg was NO joke. I thought there were laws in Europe about disability access. Clearly not.Staff were happy for me to CARRY the 15yr old down the stairs after refusing to let us use the lift. They then refused to allow us to carry the wheelchair down the stairs in case we dropped it and hurt ourselves ( they were not worried we might drop a boy with a broken leg though !). We therefore had to carry the boy EVERYWHERE!In addition they took our wheelchair and put it \u2018safely out of the way\u2019 on the TOP floor....and still wouldn\u2019t let us use the lift! Staff were rude when we got angry about the problem. ( I\u2019ve got video proof of their rudeness ). Very unimpressed and a real waste of money.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

404140880.name: Football fans dream
404140880.author: a TripAdvisor user
404140880.reviewBody: Well worth a visit to see the trophy room if nothing else! It\'s not cheap though, drinks and food are expensive outside the stadium in the eating area however if you\'re only visiting for a few hrs you don\'t need to buy anything. Kids loved it and spent an hr in the shop afterwards which is more like a mini super market. I\'d advise going when it\'s cooler however as it was 35oC when we went, phew. A good experience for footie fans

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

296253029.name: estadia nou camp fantastico
296253029.author: a TripAdvisor user
296253029.reviewBody: i got off the open top bus at the nou camp, decided to have a look inside by a stadium tour, not expensive to get in at all, lots of tourists already there proves how popular it is, massive trophy room. never seen so many trophys in one place went down the tunnel to the stadium pitch side, the size of this place from pitch side is astounding to say the least. club shop was big and very well stocked. expensive though as was most things in this city. watched a game there 10 years ago couldnt hear myself think 90,000 spaniards in 1 place, my ears were ringing for 3 days afterwards, well worth a visit to this iconic stadium even if you only see it once gotta watch a game there though if you are lucky enough to get tickets

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

242754613.name: A football fans dream...
242754613.author: a TripAdvisor user
242754613.reviewBody: I booked tickets in advance for 23 euros each, and it was worth every cent...\nYou have access to the museum, trophy rooms, pitchside, stands, press room.... the lot!\nAny football fans dream... But i cant imagine it being any good for anyone who doesnt enjoy football..

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

227164348.name: Footballing heaven!
227164348.author: a TripAdvisor user
227164348.reviewBody: I visited the camp nou during a 4 day trip to Barcelona. With me, my brother and my best friend being avid football fans and myself a Barcelona fan, I was more so excited to visit the camp nou and it didn\'t disappoint. Arriving at around 10am I was worried about large waits for tickets as literally thousands of people flood through the stadium every day. Although there was a long line of people waiting at the ticket office for the \'camp nou experience\' the line went down very quickly and tickets were obtained promptly, service was also very friendly. First, we were lucky enough to visit the "Messi area"-a temporary exhibition I believe where his golden boots and balon dor\'s were displayed-the rush to get pictures with messi\'s awards was unreal-a lot of pushing tourists but for the vast majority of photo opportunities people were generally polite and courteous allowing each other to have equal photo opportunities. So much to see here including the fantastic museum which is cleverly designed to evoke emotions-which in turn makes you willing to spend a considerable amount of euros on a photo edited image of you with your idol. Well done Barcelona marketing team! You also get to go on the stands, have a sit down and admire the marvel of the stadium, take your picture with the \'mes que un club" stand behind you. See the tunnel and walk through it up to the pitch. You can also view the away changing rooms, as well as the commentators area of the stadium. Overall, a brilliant trip for any football fan or non football fan alike. Truly a museum/stadium of emotions. Also the museum is not just about football but rather you can view basketball trophies and hockey and futsal trophies. However, price is maybe slightly on the high side for some and the shop is atrociously highly priced!!-although even that is a photo opportunity in itself. I would recommend taking your own food or eating outside of the stadium grounds because the pans company restaurant is highly over priced- nearly \u20ac3 for a small packet of Burger king sized fries. Also wear comfy shoes-plenty of walking to do. Highly recommend to any fan of football!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

188987869.name: Very good experience! 23 Euros per 1 ticket
188987869.author: a TripAdvisor user
188987869.reviewBody: I visited the Camp Nou, 23 euro each, including a Museum tour (pictures and all of the awards) and the internal stadium tour up to the field! Price is justified! Metro Maria Cristina, then 10 mins by walk.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

154350533.name: A must visit for any footy fan
154350533.author: a TripAdvisor user
154350533.reviewBody: A fantastic site to visit just to see the trophy room, memorobilia, press room and the pitch itself I enjoyed it so much

address.streetAddress: Boulevard Adolfo Lopez Mateos Oriente 1810

622138513.name: Center of Leon
622138513.author: a TripAdvisor user
622138513.reviewBody: The "Centro" as we call it in Leon is the city center. This is a good spot to visit to buy authentic Mexican food, drink a cebadina (traditional red drink of Leon), and see people enjoying life.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

510801540.name: Church on the main plaza
510801540.author: a TripAdvisor user
510801540.reviewBody: This small church is right on the main plaza, and is the perfect spot to escape the noise and bustle outside. It is currently under renovations (August 2017).

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

445024627.name: Christmas Magic in the Air
445024627.author: a TripAdvisor user
445024627.reviewBody: Being December, this is a crowded place where you will find Santa Claus, Mickey and Minnie dressed in Santa wear as well as the Grinch roaming around for a photo opp.\n\nWhat impresses me the most are the trees and how they are groomed. The fountain with the giant lions are now competing with a huge life sized nativity scene complete with animals that never made it to the region then or now unless in a zoo.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

361341111.name: Knowing about San Sebastian, Saint of the city
361341111.author: a TripAdvisor user
361341111.reviewBody: Smaller church on Leon\'s downtown but is very important because is the place to honoring to "San Sebasti\u00e1n". It was the first catholic church at city, the main Saint first was San Francisco de Asis, but at 1772 was dedicated to "San Sebasti\u00e1n". On it walls there are some paints relating to "San Sebati\u00e1n".

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

305926272.name: Beaituful place
305926272.author: a TripAdvisor user
305926272.reviewBody: Beautiful place. You can walk around down town and spend hours, food, restaurants, shops, a very Beautiful  traditional Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

286543898.name: Super
286543898.author: a TripAdvisor user
286543898.reviewBody: The tour guide was most informative and that made the day it was fun the food not so hot though the ride was bumpy but fun

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

238895520.name: Daughter visit
238895520.author: a TripAdvisor user
238895520.reviewBody:
Loved Leon and architecture plus tunnels 
Great Mexican town to really just walk and view old buildings 
Easy to get lost driving in this town
Hire local guide

address.streetAddress: Plaza de los Fundadores Centro - Guanajuato

648202873.name: Chill City
648202873.author: a TripAdvisor user
648202873.reviewBody: This is one of my favorit places to visit! Lost of places to eat, good options for those of use who are very picky, but also a nice place to just sit and take it all in.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

622485111.name: Very Pleasant.  Best plaza in Mexico.
622485111.author: a TripAdvisor user
622485111.reviewBody: This is a great place to relax and take in the culture of Mexico.  Plenty of eateries from pizza and ice cream to 5 star dinners.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

527166285.name: Worth a stop
527166285.author: a TripAdvisor user
527166285.reviewBody: Had fun strolling around here and taking it all in. There were lots of vendors out when I went which was nice to check out. Plenty of snack options and interesting buildings to admire.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

521941410.name: There was a festival
521941410.author: a TripAdvisor user
521941410.reviewBody: The day we went they set up and had a festival with live music.  The weather was warm for a mid winter day though still around 20 degrees Celsius.  The locals were friendly though most did not speak English.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

510800957.name: Pretty fountain
510800957.author: a TripAdvisor user
510800957.reviewBody: This Plaza has a nice old scool fountain in the middle. Early in the morning is a good time to people watch before it gets too hot later in the day.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

431058618.name: A must see in Le\u00f3n!
431058618.author: a TripAdvisor user
431058618.reviewBody: One of the must see places in Le\u00f3n! \nWith lots of things to do...has cheap restaurants, coffee shops, Ice cream shops, shoe shops, people watching, window shopping. The Best Hostel "El Armario" is right in the smaller plaza next to the main plaza. You have to try Leon\'s traditional drink "Cebadina". The only place it is sold is at one of the stores at the main plaza! Easy access by Taxi, bus or even walking. The Plaza is very clean and nice to spend a relaxing evening at one of the terraces drinking a beer!

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

302628892.name: A must visit place
302628892.author: a TripAdvisor user
302628892.reviewBody: A must to any visit to Leon. Very colorful, full of people with lots of snacks to eat while seating at any of the Plaza\u00b4s benches

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

295028758.name: A fun place
295028758.author: a TripAdvisor user
295028758.reviewBody:
This place is hopping with people and vendors.

Lots going on here and it's entertaining for a couple of hours. 

I recommend a visit to it.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

256022115.name: A must see in Leon
256022115.author: a TripAdvisor user
256022115.reviewBody: Even thought this my home city, Plaza Fundadores is a place I always visit when I\'m on holiday here. Colourful, charming and full of traditions.

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

213273125.name: A must see!
213273125.author: a TripAdvisor user
213273125.reviewBody: Lots of history here. Great old buildings. Colorful local performers and merchants. Nice shade trees and benches to rest. Something for everyone!

address.streetAddress: Peatonal J. Ortiz de Dominguez 102 Centro

546676208.name: Great sightseeing spot
546676208.author: a TripAdvisor user
546676208.reviewBody: Plaza Martires del 2 de Enero is a beautiful, bustling spot especially during Christmas time when it is lit up with lots of festive lights.  This is a great place to sightsee and get a feel for the people of Le\u00f3n, grab a bite, get a drink or do some light shopping.  I\'d recommend taking pictures in the evening after the crowds have cleared.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

521937204.name: A Mexico adventure
521937204.author: a TripAdvisor user
521937204.reviewBody: My friends and their family took me this this amazing place. I tried the traditional lion drink- very sweet.  It was full of fun lovely people. I felt safe and has fun. The kids seemed to enjoy all the sights as well.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

510800403.name: Nice bandstand!
510800403.author: a TripAdvisor user
510800403.reviewBody: This Plaza in central Leon is well kept with pretty sculpted bushes. I really like the old style bandstand in the middle! This plaza is a great place to get your shoes shined.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

446746423.name: The square was nice to see but it\'s a little tired
446746423.author: a TripAdvisor user
446746423.reviewBody: LOTS of people there with kids and family (Sunday) so that was great. Not a lot to do there really but just sit and people watch. The whole square could use a make over, but....glad we went to see it. Couple places to eat in the square. They seemed ok although we didn\'t eat there.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

398830465.name: Beautiful Plaza
398830465.author: a TripAdvisor user
398830465.reviewBody: I visited this plaza early in the morning and activities and people were just gathering. It rivals plazas of Paris, I kid you not. Go and see.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

326219249.name: In downtown Le\u00f3n this is the place to people watch!
326219249.author: a TripAdvisor user
326219249.reviewBody: Great food, great shops, beautiful Mexican central plaza, kids, families and people doing many interesting things.  This the heart beat of Le\u00f3n.  The central market is near by which is also excellent, I still dream of my extra shrimp cocktails for pennies on the peso!

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

320776738.name: Sunday midday: Lots of shade, benches and music
320776738.author: a TripAdvisor user
320776738.reviewBody: Beautiful square with added bonus of free brass band music from midday to 1p. Ideal for people watching.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

158385407.name: Nice square, but
158385407.author: a TripAdvisor user
158385407.reviewBody: There are a lot of local people hanging out in the afternoon. It is beautiful, but too crowded. There are only few restaurants around and most of them are pizzaria.

address.streetAddress: Centro de Leon

649159040.name: Park with a view
649159040.author: a TripAdvisor user
649159040.reviewBody: This place is a short walk from the Cathedral. I missed it the first time so just look down the street and you will see it.  There is seating to simply relax and people watch as you view the Calzada de las Artes. There are a few other statutes on the boardwalk.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908

511442819.name: Nice walking spot
511442819.author: a TripAdvisor user
511442819.reviewBody: Reading the other reviews here, there seems to be some confusion as to what and where this is, but it is definitely not where the map shows it. If it is the pedestrian median strip leading up to the Triumphal Arch, then it is a pretty and pleasant spot for an early morning walk.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908

506305481.name: Iconic area from el bajio
506305481.author: a TripAdvisor user
506305481.reviewBody: This is right in the middle of leon.  I walked from the love bridge to the rincon taurino, to the arc and from there to all the downtown bars.   It was very live on a Saturday night.  I loved this area.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Calzada de los Ninos Heroes 908

526107616.name: Breathtaking
526107616.author: a TripAdvisor user
526107616.reviewBody: This magnificent place of worship is yet another fine example of churches in this part of the world.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia del Sagrado Corazon de Jesus

address.streetAddress: Calle Principal 738 San Jose El Alto

363192497.name: CATHOLIC CHURCH NEAR TO MULZA OUTLET AT LEON
363192497.author: a TripAdvisor user
363192497.reviewBody: At Sunday when you are at MULZA Outlet, or FACTORY OUTLET or Altacia, and you need a time for Church service it\'s near Parroquia del Sagrado Corazon de Jes\u00fas. It\'s a small and beautiful church inside a traditional community at Leon, Gto. The services are on morning (8 am) and night (8 pm), near to the church you can find on the same street traditional Mexican snacks.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia del Sagrado Corazon de Jesus

address.streetAddress: Calle Principal 738 San Jose El Alto

639229987.name: Variedad y Estilo
639229987.author: a TripAdvisor user
639229987.reviewBody: A women\'s dream to be at this place that has sooo many stiles and colors of shoes and booths. There are many many stores, all about shoes and the prices are incredible low, you just can buy one pair...

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

564449823.name: Disappointed in Leather
564449823.author: a TripAdvisor user
564449823.reviewBody: Unfortunately this did not live up to the billing.  What was once a place to browse Mexican leather has become the home of China knockoffs.  I did find some good quality goods off the main drag that was made in Mexico.  You can see store after store of similar items.  It is best to have a specific type of item in mind and hit the shops that focus on those.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

560038835.name: A corner stone in the leather district
560038835.author: a TripAdvisor user
560038835.reviewBody: The Shore Mall was originally the big new shoe place. Of course, things have evolved, and competition springs up in the form of the new outlet malls on the edge of town. But the plaza is still a nice place to visit and seems to have some decent buys still on the name brands.  The parking is good, and it has easy access.  \n\nOut the main doors towards the bus station, you also have easy access to the leather district, mostly across the street, which is full of shoe and leather bargains, and worth a look, although granted it can get very, very crowded on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

484595673.name: No cheap buys here
484595673.author: a TripAdvisor user
484595673.reviewBody: Visited the place when the just opened on a week day.  The shoping experience is like you were at a mall.  Very good quality items may be found on this location, but if you are shoping for cheap, real leather items, this is not the spot.  The walk on this place is very short although It does have 2 floors.  Place is very clean and people are not pushy for a sale.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

442937348.name: VAlue, but you have to look.
442937348.author: a TripAdvisor user
442937348.reviewBody: AT first I said to myself, another shoe store...but after spending two hours there I did find some very good buys.  MOst of the problem is size...many shoes may go to nine but that is it for women.  I found Purse store where prices were 33$ and they look and feel like 150$ purse.  THe store is on the upper level about half way and only sells good purses...good display too. I bought three and wish I had gotten some more for family and friends.  FLexi shoes for men were from 800-1200 pesos...a very nice shoe, not super high end though there were a few..wing tip shoes were about 1200 pesos or sixty dollars.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

430671535.name: Nice but small!
430671535.author: a TripAdvisor user
430671535.reviewBody: It is a nice plaza, cozy but small!\nYou immediately feel the need to find more stores to have more choices of shoes! Don\'t be fooled here or at the Outlet!: ALL SHOE PRICES ARE NORMAL, NO DISCOUNTS OR SALES!!

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

335784187.name: Over rated
335784187.author: a TripAdvisor user
335784187.reviewBody: This is the shoe plaza in the downtown area. Nice but limited. The new Shoe Outlet is a massive place.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

324770847.name: Shopping spree
324770847.author: a TripAdvisor user
324770847.reviewBody: Very modern and clean facility.  Our friends found a lot of American friendly items to purchase.  Much different atmosphere than the mercado next door. Little disappointed none of the shops would accept the discount coupon the hotel gave us.  The coupon did not state any restrictions..

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

318821741.name: Overated$$$
318821741.author: a TripAdvisor user
318821741.reviewBody: This shoe mall is pricey crocs are almost $80usd expensive among other brand. Best bet buy your shoes in the U.S. Only two floors.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

308581667.name: Millions of shoes
308581667.author: a TripAdvisor user
308581667.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for shoes this is the place for you! All products are made locally in the Leon \u00e1rea, with great prices. It is well worth walking down the Street to the \u00e1rea around the bus station and browse the seemingly endless leather shops which besides shoes sell nice jackets, purses, suitcases, briefcases, etc, etc.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Alvaro Obregon # 261

295027218.name: Not worth the visit.
295027218.author: a TripAdvisor user
295027218.reviewBody: This "shoes mall" is definitely overrated. Nothing special about the stores or the shoes they offer.\n\nI recommend that you spend your time elsewhere.
